abstract: Alina Tugend Shortcuts column observes that as aging population grows, experts in hospice care are seeing a growing interest in so-called death doulas, also known as end-of-life doulas and death midwives; services vary from volunteers who simply make visits, to others who charge for things like organizing paperwork, living with a patient or assisting with funeral arrangements.
lead_paragraph: Services vary from volunteers who simply make visits, to those who charge for helping with arrangements like caregivers or organizing papers.
snippet: Services vary from volunteers who simply make visits, to those who charge for helping with arrangements like caregivers or organizing papers.

headline.main: Doulas, Who Usher in New Life, Find Mission in Support for the Dying
headline.print_headline: Doulas, Who Usher In New Life, Find Mission in Support for the Dying
